div.p: STEPHANIUM, in botany : A genus of the monogynia order, belonging to the pentandria claſs of plants; and in the natural method ranking under the 47th order, Stellata. The calyx is monophyllous, turbinated, and quinquepartite ; the corolla is monopetalous, funnel-ſhaped, having its tubes curved and ventricoſe : the pericarpium is a bilocular berry containing two ſeeds, flattened on one side and round on the other. This genus is nearly allied to that of Pſychotria. There is only one ſpecies, viz. Guianenſe, a native of the warmer parts of America.
